sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"经历，经受，遭受"之意。
means: undergo ： 多指经受艰难、痛苦、不愉快或危险等事。
experience ： 指亲身经受或体验某事。
sustain ： 指遭受痛苦或承受负担。
suffer常可与sustain通用，尤指受到损害或伤害。

sentence.Network_en: The most pleasurable experience of the evening was the wonderful fireworks display.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个晚上最让人高兴的就是精彩的焰火表演。

sentence.Network_en: Few would argue that this team has experience and proven ability.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个队伍的丰富经验和表现出来的实力是众所公认的。

sentence.Network_en: His office was in keeping with his station and experience.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的办公室与其身份和阅历相称。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 经验主义强调经验（experience）和证据（evidence），主张人出生下来就像一张白纸，透过感官经验累积知识，因此人类大部分的 …
更字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 更换;替代〖 replace〗 经过,经历〖 experience〗 连续,接续〖 continue〗.
...设计的网络认证、双处理器等特性。且家庭版只支持1个处理器，专业版则支持2个。字母XP表示英文单词的“体验”（experience）。
有工作经验(experience)者优先。招聘人数:1人。

list.abs: 高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... con n 反对 experiment n 实验； 试验 glove n 手套.
高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... con n 反对 experiment n 实验； 试验 glove n 手套.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin experientia, from experiri 'try'. Compare with experiment and expert

entry.def: Experience is knowledge or skill in a particular job or activity, which you have gained because you have done that job or activity for a long time.

example.ex: He has also had managerial experience on every level...
example.tran: 他还有各个层级的管理经验。

example.ex: He's counting on his mother to take care of the twins for him; she's had plenty of experience with them.
example.tran: 他靠母亲帮忙照顾他的双胞胎;她在这方面很有经验。

entry.tran: （组成个人生活或形成个性的）经历，阅历
entry.def: Experience is used to refer to the past events, knowledge, and feelings that make up someone's life or character.

example.ex: I should not be in any danger here, but experience has taught me caution...
example.tran: 我在这里应该不会有任何危险，但是经验告诉我要小心。

example.ex: She had learned from experience to take little rests in between her daily routine...
example.tran: 经验告诉她在日常生活中要不时休息一下。

entry.def: An experience is something that you do or that happens to you, especially something important that affects you.

example.ex: Moving had become a common experience for me...
example.tran: 搬家对我而言已经成了常事。

example.ex: His only experience of gardening so far proved immensely satisfying...
example.tran: 到目前为止他唯一的一次园艺经历非常令人满意。

entry.def: If you experience a particular situation, you are in that situation or it happens to you.

example.ex: We had never experienced this kind of holiday before and had no idea what to expect...
example.tran: 我们以前从未有过这样的假期，不知道会怎么样。

example.ex: British business is now experiencing a severe recession.
example.tran: 英国商业现在正经历严重的衰退。

entry.def: If you experience a feeling, you feel it or are affected by it.

example.ex: Widows seem to experience more distress than do widowers.
example.tran: 寡妇似乎比鳏夫更痛苦。

means.word_mean: 1. the accumulation of knowledge or skill that results from direct participation in events or activities;
2. the content of direct observation or participation in an event;

sentences.sentence: "that painful experience certainly got our attention"
"We had many trials to go through"

means.word_mean: 2. have firsthand knowledge of states, situations, emotions, or sensations;

sentences.sentence: "I have lived a kind of hell when I was a drug addict"
"The holocaust survivors have lived a nightmare"

means.word_mean: 3. of mental or physical states or experiences;

auth_sentence.content: They are human, but they have more experience.
auth_sentence.res_content: They are human, but they have more experience.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They are human, but they have more experience.

auth_sentence.content: There's been a big age and experience gap.
auth_sentence.res_content: There's been a big age and experience gap.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There's been a big age and experience gap.

auth_sentence.content: They say unpaid work experience is not an option.
auth_sentence.res_content: They say unpaid work experience is not an option.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They say unpaid work experience is not an option.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 凭经验[或观察]的,经验主义的
stems_affixes.word_buile: empiric[n.经验主义者,[古]江湖医生]+al……的→adj.凭经验[或观察]的,经验主义的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 实验的, 根据实验的
stems_affixes.word_buile: experiment实验+al……的→adj.实验的, 根据实验的
ex出+pert=peri尝试→尝试出来→[成为]专家, 行家

stems_affixes.value_cn: 实验上, 用实验方法
stems_affixes.word_buile: experimental实验的+ly……地→adv.实验上, 用实验方法

stems_affixes.value_cn: 经验主义者,[古]江湖医生
stems_affixes.word_buile: em出+piri=peri尝试+c→尝试出来的→经验
empiric[n.经验主义者,[古]江湖医生]+ism主义→n.经验主义
ex出+peri尝试+ment表名词→尝试出来→实验

stems_affixes.value_cn: 实验, 试验, 实验法
stems_affixes.word_buile: experiment[n.实验;试验 v.[on]进行实验;做试验]+ation表名词→n.实验, 试验, 实验法
ex出+pert=peri尝试→尝试出来→[成为]专家, 行家
ex出+peri尝试+ence表名词→尝试出来的东西→经验
ex出+peri尝试+ment表名词→尝试出来→实验
ex出+pert=peri尝试→尝试出来→[成为]专家, 行家

means.word_mean: 经历; 阅历; 感受, 体会

sentences.en: None of the others have lived my experiences.
sentences.cn: 没有任何人体验过我的经历。

means.word_mean: 经历, 体验; 感受, 遭受

sentences.en: She experienced a joy in helping others in trouble.
sentences.cn: 她感受到了帮助有困难的人带来的快乐。

sentences.en: He's a man who has experienced suffering.

means.word_mean: 发现，通过亲身经历认识到，体验到

sentences.en: I have experienced that the sunrise can be so beautiful.

jushi.english: Even the lapse of many years will never erase the memory of that experience from my mind.
jushi.chinese: 即便是很多年时光的流逝也绝不会把对这一经历的记忆从我的心中抹去。

jushi.english: He wrote the book from his own experiences.
jushi.chinese: 他以个人经历写成这本书。

jushi.english: The experiences of the elderly are quite useful to the young.
jushi.chinese: 对年轻人来说,长辈的经验是十分有用的。
